content: The omnibus appropriations resolution for FY2003 (H.J.Res. 2) was signed into law as P.L. 108-7 on February 20, 2003. It provided funding for Interior and related agencies, as well as 10 other regular appropriations bills not enacted for FY2003. The final FY2003 appropriation included $19.08 billion for Interior and related agencies, along with $825.0 million to repay transferred amounts for fire fighting in FY2002. This bill also included a 0.65% across-the-board cut. The omnibus appropriations resolution for FY2003 (H.J.Res. 2) was signed into law as P.L. 108-7 on February 20, 2003, providing funding for Interior and related agencies, along with 10 other regular appropriations bills not enacted for FY2003. President Bush submitted his FY2003 budget to Congress, requesting $18.94 billion for Interior and related agencies, a decrease from the previous year. The budget included allocations for agencies within DOI, such as $2.36 billion for the National Park Service and $2.25 billion for the Bureau of Indian Affairs. Other related agencies received funding as well, with the Forest Service allocated $3.95 billion and the Indian Health Service receiving $2.82 billion. The FY2003 budget included allocations for various agencies, with proposed increases for some, such as the Indian Health Service and Bureau of Indian Affairs, and decreases for others like the Forest Service and Department of Energy. Members questioned proposed cuts to the U.S. Geological Survey and workforce restructuring.
